content.description: In Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a charged capacitor of capacitance <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> is connected to two resistors with resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and two switches, <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mtext>S</mtext> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math> and <math alttext="S sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, as shown. Switch <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is closed and the potential difference across the capacitor decreases to <math alttext="37%" overflow="scroll"><mn>37</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of its initial value in time <math alttext="t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is identical to Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> except both switches are closed at the same time. The potential difference across the capacitor decreases to <math alttext="37%" overflow="scroll"> <mn>37</mn> <mo>%</mo> </math> of its initial value in time <math alttext="t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.
content.question: What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction with numerator t sub 2, and denominator t sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <mfrac> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mfrac> </math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
